Yes, Beyonce has been a strong advocate for gender equality and women’s rights. She has used her platform to speak out against various issues affecting women, including gender-based violence, reproductive health issues, and gender discrimination. Below are some of the ways Beyonce has addressed these issues:

1. Feminism - Beyonce has identified as a feminist and has been vocal about her beliefs in women's equality. She has also used her music to express feminist themes, such as in her song "Flawless" which features Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie's speech on feminism.

2. UN Women's Global Gender Equality Movement - In 2013, Beyonce joined the United Nations' global gender equality movement "Chime for Change" as a co-founder, working to address issues of women's empowerment, education, and health.

3. Salute to Women - Beyonce has also honored and celebrated women's achievements through her music and performances. She has dedicated songs and performances to women who have made a significant impact in their respective fields.

4. Supporting Women Entrepreneurs - Beyonce has also supported women entrepreneurs through her Ivy Park brand. She has featured stories of women entrepreneurs on the Ivy Park website, showcasing their businesses and empowering them through partnerships and collaborations.

5. She promotes body positivity - Beyonce has promoted body positivity and self-love through her music and lifestyle. She showcases diverse body types and has embraced her own natural shape. She has also encouraged her fans to embrace their bodies and promote positive self-esteem.
